subject: Career
title: Sponsorship vs. Mentorship at Work
description: A 60-second lesson on Sponsorship vs. Mentorship at Work.

hook.text: A mentor gives advice. A sponsor gives opportunities. One talks to you. The other talks about you.

buildup.text: Sylvia Ann Hewlett's research shows sponsorship is the number one predictor of career advancement.

discovery.text: Sponsors advocate for you in rooms you're not in. They put their reputation behind your promotion.

twist.text: You can't ask for a sponsor directly. You earn sponsorship by delivering results that make them look good.

climax.text: Find a senior leader whose success depends on your work. Deliver excellence. Sponsorship follows.

punchline.text: Mentors guide your thinking. Sponsors change your trajectory.

quiz.question: What's the key difference between a mentor and a sponsor?
options: A sponsor advocates for you in rooms you're not in
